title: Mark 1:1
content: 1 The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

title: Mark 1:2
content: 2 Just as it has been written in Isaiah the prophet, “Behold, I am sending my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way;

title: Mark 1:3
content: 3 a voice of one calling out in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord; make his paths straight.’”

title: Mark 1:4
content: 4 John came, the one baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.

title: Mark 1:5
content: 5 And all the Judea region and all the Jerusalemites were going out to him and were being baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.

title: Mark 1:6
content: 6 And John was clothed with camel hair and a leather belt around his waist, and {he was} eating locusts and wild honey.

title: Mark 1:7
content: 7 And he was proclaiming, saying, “One more powerful than I is coming after me, of whom I am not worthy, stooping down, to untie the strap of his sandals.

title: Mark 1:8
content: 8 I baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”

title: Mark 1:9
content: 9 And it happened that in those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee, and he was baptized by John in the Jordan.

title: Mark 1:10
content: 10 And immediately, coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens being split open and the Spirit coming down on him like a dove.

title: Mark 1:11
content: 11 And a voice came out of the heavens, “You are my beloved Son. With you, I am well pleased.”

title: Mark 1:12
content: 12 And immediately, the Spirit casts him out into the wilderness.

title: Mark 1:13
content: 13 And he was in the wilderness 40 days, being tempted by Satan. And he was with the wild animals, and the angels were serving him.

title: Mark 1:14
content: 14 But after John was handed over, Jesus came to Galilee, proclaiming the gospel of God

title: Mark 1:15
content: 15 and saying, “The time has been fulfilled, and the kingdom of God has come near. Repent and believe in the gospel.”

title: Mark 1:16
content: 16 And passing beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew, the brother of Simon, net-casting into the sea, for they were fishermen.

title: Mark 1:17
content: 17 And Jesus said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.”

title: Mark 1:18
content: 18 And immediately, having left the nets, they followed him.

title: Mark 1:19
content: 19 And having gone on a little farther, he saw James, the {son} of Zebedee, and John, his brother, and they {were} mending the nets in the boat.

title: Mark 1:20
content: 20 And immediately he called them and, having left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, they went away after him.

title: Mark 1:21
content: 21 And they enter into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbaths, having entered into the synagogue, he was teaching.

title: Mark 1:22
content: 22 And they were astonished at his teaching, for he was teaching them as having authority and not as the scribes.

title: Mark 1:23
content: 23 And immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,

title: Mark 1:24
content: 24 saying, “What to us and to you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”

title: Mark 1:25
content: 25 And Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silenced and come out from him!”

title: Mark 1:26
content: 26 And having convulsed him and having cried out with a loud voice, the unclean spirit went out from him.

title: Mark 1:27
content: 27 And they all were amazed, so that they discussed among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching according to authority! And he commands the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”

title: Mark 1:28
content: 28 And the hearing of him immediately went out everywhere into the whole surrounding region of Galilee.

title: Mark 1:29
content: 29 And immediately, having come out from the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, along with James and John.

title: Mark 1:30
content: 30 Now the mother-in-law of Simon was lying down, being sick with a fever, and immediately they speak to him concerning her.

title: Mark 1:31
content: 31 And having approached, he raised her up, having taken hold of her hand, and the fever left her, and she was serving them.

title: Mark 1:32
content: 32 Now evening having come, after the sun {had} set, they were bringing to him all the ones having sickness and the ones possessed by demons.

title: Mark 1:33
content: 33 And the whole city was gathered together at the door.

title: Mark 1:34
content: 34 And he healed many having sickness with various diseases and cast out many demons, but he was not permitting the demons to speak, because they knew him.

title: Mark 1:35
content: 35 And in the morning, {while it was} still very dark, having gotten up, he went out and went away to a desolate place, and there he was praying.

title: Mark 1:36
content: 36 And Simon and the ones with him pursued him

title: Mark 1:37
content: 37 and found him and say to him, “All are seeking you.”

title: Mark 1:38
content: 38 And he says to them, “Let us go elsewhere, into the surrounding towns, so that I may preach there also, because for this I went out.”

title: Mark 1:39
content: 39 And he went in all Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and casting out the demons.

title: Mark 1:40
content: 40 And a leper comes to him, begging him and kneeling down, saying to him, “If you are willing, you are able to make me clean.”

title: Mark 1:41
content: 41 And having had compassion, having reached out his hand, he touched {him} and says to him, “I am willing. Be clean.”

title: Mark 1:42
content: 42 And immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.

title: Mark 1:43
content: 43 But having strictly warned him, he immediately sent him away.

title: Mark 1:44
content: 44 And he says to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

title: Mark 1:45
content: 45 But he, having gone out, began to proclaim much and to report the word, so that he was able no longer to enter into a town openly, but he was out in desolate places, and they were coming to him from all sides.

title: Mark 2:1
content: 1 And having entered again into Capernaum after {some} days, it was heard that he is in a house.

title: Mark 2:2
content: 2 And many were gathered, so that it could no longer receive, not even the {areas} at the door, and he was speaking the word to them.

title: Mark 2:3
content: 3 And they come bringing to him a paralytic, being carried by four men.

title: Mark 2:4
content: 4 And not being able to bring {him} to him because of the crowd, they removed the roof where he was, and having dug {it} out, they lower the mat where the paralytic was lying.

title: Mark 2:5
content: 5 And Jesus, having seen their faith, says to the paralytic, “Child, your sins are forgiven.”

title: Mark 2:6
content: 6 But some of the scribes were sitting there and debating in their hearts,

title: Mark 2:7
content: 7 “Why does this one speak in this way? He blasphemes! Who is able to forgive sins except one, God?”

title: Mark 2:8
content: 8 And immediately Jesus, having known in his spirit that they are debating in this way within themselves, says to them, “Why are you debating these things in your hearts?

title: Mark 2:9
content: 9 Which is easier to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven’ or to say, ‘Get up and take up your mat and walk’?

title: Mark 2:10
content: 10 But in order that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on the earth to forgive sins,”—he says to the paralytic—

title: Mark 2:11
content: 11 “I say to you, get up, pick up your mat, and go to your house.”

title: Mark 2:12
content: 12 And having gotten up and immediately having taken up the mat, he went out before all, so that all were amazed and glorified God, saying, “We never saw thus.”

title: Mark 2:13
content: 13 And he went out again beside the sea, and all the crowd was coming to him, and he was teaching them.

title: Mark 2:14
content: 14 And passing by, he saw Levi the {son} of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector’s office, and he says to him, “Follow me.” And having gotten up, he followed him.

title: Mark 2:15
content: 15 And it happens {that} he reclined to eat in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners were dining with Jesus and his disciples, for they were many, and they were following him.

title: Mark 2:16
content: 16 And the scribes of the Pharisees, having seen that he eats with the sinners and tax collectors, were saying to his disciples, “Does he eat with the tax collectors and sinners?”

title: Mark 2:17
content: 17 And having heard, Jesus says to them, “The ones being healthy do not have need of a physician, but the ones having sickness. I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”

title: Mark 2:18
content: 18 And the disciples of John and the Pharisees were fasting, and they come and say to him, “For what reason do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?”

title: Mark 2:19
content: 19 And Jesus said to them, “The sons of the bridal chamber are not able to fast while the bridegroom is still with them, are they? As much time as they have the bridegroom with them, they are not able to fast.

title: Mark 2:20
content: 20 But days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and in those days, then they will fast.

title: Mark 2:21
content: 21 No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, but if not, the patch tears away from it, the new from the old, and a worse tear happens.

title: Mark 2:22
content: 22 And no one puts new wine into old wineskins, but if not, the wine will burst the wineskins and the wine and the wineskins are destroyed, but new wine into new wineskins.”

title: Mark 2:23
content: 23 And it happened {that}, on the Sabbaths, he was passing through the grainfields, and his disciples began to make a way, picking the heads of grain.

title: Mark 2:24
content: 24 And the Pharisees were saying to him, “Behold, why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbaths?”

title: Mark 2:25
content: 25 And he says to them, “Have you never read what David did when he had need and was hungry, he and the ones with him—

title: Mark 2:26
content: 26 how he went into the house of God in the time of Abiathar the high priest and ate the loaves of the presence, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and he also gave to the ones being with him?”

title: Mark 2:27
content: 27 And he was saying to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath.

title: Mark 2:28
content: 28 Therefore, the Son of Man is Lord, even of the Sabbath.”

title: Mark 3:1
content: 1 And he entered into a synagogue again, and there was a man there having a withered hand.

title: Mark 3:2
content: 2 And they were watching him closely, if he will heal him on the Sabbaths, so that they might accuse him.

title: Mark 3:3
content: 3 And he says to the man having the withered hand, “Get up in the midst.”

title: Mark 3:4
content: 4 And he says to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbaths to do good or to do harm; to save a life or to kill?” But they were keeping silent.

title: Mark 3:5
content: 5 And having looked around at them with anger, being grieved by the hardness of their heart, he says to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out, and his hand was restored.

title: Mark 3:6
content: 6 And having gone out, the Pharisees immediately were making counsel with the Herodians against him so that they might destroy him.

title: Mark 3:7
content: 7 And Jesus, with his disciples, withdrew to the sea, and a great multitude followed from Galilee. And from Judea

title: Mark 3:8
content: 8 and from Jerusalem and from Idumea and beyond the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon a great multitude, hearing how much he was doing, came to him.

title: Mark 3:9
content: 9 And he spoke to his disciples so that a small boat might be ready for him because of the crowd, so that they might not press against him.

title: Mark 3:10
content: 10 For he healed many, so that as many as had afflictions pressed against him so that they might touch him.

title: Mark 3:11
content: 11 And whenever the unclean spirits saw him, they were falling down before him and crying out, saying, “You are the Son of God.”

title: Mark 3:12
content: 12 And he was rebuking them much so that they might not make him known.

title: Mark 3:13
content: 13 And he goes up on the mountain and summons those whom he was wanting, and they went away to him.

title: Mark 3:14
content: 14 And he appointed 12, whom he also named apostles, so that they might be with him and so that he might send them to preach

title: Mark 3:15
content: 15 and to have authority to cast out the demons.

title: Mark 3:16
content: 16 And he appointed the Twelve, and he gave to Simon the name Peter;

title: Mark 3:17
content: 17 and James the {son} of Zebedee, and John the brother of James, and he gave names to them, Boanerges, that is, Sons of Thunder;

title: Mark 3:18
content: 18 and Andrew and Philip and Bartholomew and Matthew and Thomas and James the {son} of Alphaeus and Thaddaeus and Simon the Cananaios

title: Mark 3:19
content: 19 and Judas Iscariot, who also handed him over.

title: Mark 3:20
content: 20 And he comes into a house, and the crowd comes together again, so that they were not able even to eat bread.

title: Mark 3:21
content: 21 And the ones from him, having heard, went out to seize him, for they were saying, “He is out of his mind.”

title: Mark 3:22
content: 22 And the scribes having come down from Jerusalem were saying, “He has Beelzebul” and “By the ruler of the demons he casts out the demons.”

title: Mark 3:23
content: 23 And having summoned them, in parables he was saying to them, “How is Satan able to cast out Satan?

title: Mark 3:24
content: 24 And if a kingdom has been divided against itself, that kingdom is not able to stand.

title: Mark 3:25
content: 25 And if a house has been divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.

title: Mark 3:26
content: 26 And if Satan rose up against himself and was divided, he is not able to stand, but he has an end.

title: Mark 3:27
content: 27 But no one is able, having entered into the house of the strong man, to steal his possessions if he has not first bound the strong man, and then he will plunder his house.

title: Mark 3:28
content: 28 Truly I say to you that all the sins and the blasphemies, as much as they may blaspheme, will be forgiven the sons of men,

title: Mark 3:29
content: 29 but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit does not have forgiveness to eternity but is guilty of an eternal sin”—

title: Mark 3:30
content: 30 because they were saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”

title: Mark 3:31
content: 31 And his mother and his brothers come, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.

title: Mark 3:32
content: 32 And a crowd was sitting around him, and they say to him, “Behold, your mother and your brothers seek you outside.”

title: Mark 3:33
content: 33 And answering them, he says, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”

title: Mark 3:34
content: 34 And having looked around at the ones sitting in a circle around him, he says, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!

title: Mark 3:35
content: 35 For whoever does the will of God, this is my brother and sister and mother.”

title: Mark 4:1
content: 1 And again, he began to teach beside the sea, and the largest crowd is gathered to him. As a result, having gotten into a boat, he sat down on the sea, and the whole crowd was on the land beside the sea.

title: Mark 4:2
content: 2 And he was teaching them many things in parables, and he was saying to them in his teaching,

title: Mark 4:3
content: 3 “Listen! Behold, the sower went out to sow.

title: Mark 4:4
content: 4 And it happened that as he sowed, some fell beside the road, and the birds came and devoured it.

title: Mark 4:5
content: 5 And other fell on the rocky ground, where it did not have much soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it did not have deep soil.

title: Mark 4:6
content: 6 And when the sun rose, it was scorched, and because it had no root, it withered.

title: Mark 4:7
content: 7 And other fell into the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it did not give fruit.

title: Mark 4:8
content: 8 And others fell on the good soil, and it was giving fruit, growing up and being increased, and one was bearing 30, and one, 60, and one, 100.”

title: Mark 4:9
content: 9 And he was saying, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear!”

title: Mark 4:10
content: 10 And when he was alone, the ones around him with the Twelve were asking him about the parables.

title: Mark 4:11
content: 11 And he was saying to them, “To you has been given the mystery of the kingdom of God, but to those, the ones outside, everything is in parables,

title: Mark 4:12
content: 12 so that, ‘Looking, they may look but may not see, and hearing, they may hear but may not understand, lest they might turn back, and it might be forgiven to them.’”

title: Mark 4:13
content: 13 And he says to them, “Do you not understand this parable? And how will you understand all the parables?

title: Mark 4:14
content: 14 The sower sows the word.

title: Mark 4:15
content: 15 Now these are the ones beside the road, where the word is being sown, but whenever they have heard it, Satan immediately comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.

title: Mark 4:16
content: 16 And similarly, these are the ones being sown on the rocky ground, who, whenever they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy,

title: Mark 4:17
content: 17 and they have no root in themselves, but are temporary. Then, tribulation or persecution having happened because of the word, immediately they are caused to stumble.

title: Mark 4:18
content: 18 And others are the ones being sown into the thorns. These are the ones having heard the word,

title: Mark 4:19
content: 19 and the worries of the age and the deceitfulness of riches and the desires concerning other things, entering in, choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

title: Mark 4:20
content: 20 And those are the ones sown on the good soil, who hear the word and receive it and bear fruit—one, 30, and one, 60, and one, 100.”

title: Mark 4:21
content: 21 And he was saying to them, “The lamp does not come so that it might be put under the basket or under the bed, does it? Is it not so that it might be put on the lampstand?

title: Mark 4:22
content: 22 For it is not hidden except so that it might be revealed, nor has it become secret except so that it might come into visibility.

title: Mark 4:23
content: 23 If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”

title: Mark 4:24
content: 24 And he was saying to them, “Watch what you hear. With the measure by which you measure, it will be measured to you, and it will be added to you.

title: Mark 4:25
content: 25 For he who has, it will be given to him, and he who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.”

title: Mark 4:26
content: 26 And he was saying, “Thus is the kingdom of God: As a man throws the seed on the ground,

title: Mark 4:27
content: 27 and he sleeps and gets up, night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows—how, he himself does not know.

title: Mark 4:28
content: 28 The soil produces a crop of its own accord: first a blade, then a head, then a mature grain in the head.

title: Mark 4:29
content: 29 And whenever the fruit hands over, he immediately sends the sickle, because the harvest has come.”

title: Mark 4:30
content: 30 And he was saying, “How will we compare the kingdom of God, or in what parable will we put it?

title: Mark 4:31
content: 31 {It is} like a mustard seed, which, when it has been sown in the soil, being the smallest of all the seeds on the earth,

title: Mark 4:32
content: 32 and when it has been sown, it grows and becomes greater than all the vegetable plants, and it makes large branches, so that the birds of the sky are able to nest in its shadow.”

title: Mark 4:33
content: 33 And with many such parables he was speaking the word to them, just as they were able to hear;

title: Mark 4:34
content: 34 but he was not speaking to them without a parable, but by himself he was explaining everything to his own disciples.

title: Mark 4:35
content: 35 And he says to them on that day, evening having come, “Let us cross over to the other side.”

title: Mark 4:36
content: 36 And having left the crowd, they take him with {them}, as he was, in the boat, and other boats were with him.

title: Mark 4:37
content: 37 And a great storm of wind happens, and the waves were breaking into the boat, so that the boat was already filled.

title: Mark 4:38
content: 38 And he himself was in the stern, sleeping on the cushion. And they wake him up and say to him, “Teacher, is it not a concern to you that we are perishing?”

title: Mark 4:39
content: 39 And awaking, he rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Be silent! Be still!” And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

title: Mark 4:40
content: 40 And he said to them, “Why are you cowardly? Do you not yet have faith?”

title: Mark 4:41
content: 41 And they feared a great fear and were saying to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

title: Mark 5:1
content: 1 And they came to the other side of the sea, to the region of the Gerasenes.

title: Mark 5:2
content: 2 And he having gone out from the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him from the tombs,

title: Mark 5:3
content: 3 who had his dwelling in the tombs, and no one was able to bind him anymore, not even with a chain,

title: Mark 5:4
content: 4 because he had often been bound with shackles and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him and the shackles had been shattered, and no one was strong enough to subdue him.

title: Mark 5:5
content: 5 And throughout every night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out and cutting himself with stones.

title: Mark 5:6
content: 6 And having seen Jesus from a distance, he ran to him and bowed down to him.

title: Mark 5:7
content: 7 And crying out with a loud voice, he says, “What to me and to you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I make you swear by God, do not torment me.”

title: Mark 5:8
content: 8 For he was saying to him, “Come out from the man, unclean spirit.”

title: Mark 5:9
content: 9 And he was asking him, “What {is} your name?” And he says to him, “My name {is} Legion, for we are many.”

title: Mark 5:10
content: 10 And he was begging him much that he would not send them out of the region.

title: Mark 5:11
content: 11 But there was a great herd of pigs being fed on the hill,

title: Mark 5:12
content: 12 and they begged him, saying, “Send us into the pigs, so that we might enter into them.”

title: Mark 5:13
content: 13 And he permitted them, and having come out, the unclean spirits entered into the pigs, and the herd—about 2, 000—rushed down the steep slope into the sea and were drowned in the sea.

title: Mark 5:14
content: 14 And the ones feeding them ran away and reported it in the city and in the countryside, and they went out to see what it is that had happened.

title: Mark 5:15
content: 15 And they come to Jesus and see the one being demon-possessed, sitting, clothed and being sound-minded—the one that had had the legion—and they were afraid.

title: Mark 5:16
content: 16 And the ones having seen explained to them how it happened to the one being demon-possessed, and about the pigs.

title: Mark 5:17
content: 17 And they began to beg him to depart from their region.

title: Mark 5:18
content: 18 And he getting into the boat, the one having been demon-possessed was begging him so that he might be with him.

title: Mark 5:19
content: 19 And he did not permit him, but he says to him, “Go to your house, to your {people}, and report to them as much as the Lord has done for you and had mercy on you.”

title: Mark 5:20
content: 20 And he went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis as much as Jesus did for him, and all were marveling.

title: Mark 5:21
content: 21 And Jesus having crossed over again to the other side in the boat, a great crowd was gathered around him, and he was beside the sea.

title: Mark 5:22
content: 22 And behold, one of the synagogue rulers, Jairus by name, comes, and having seen him, he falls at his feet.

title: Mark 5:23
content: 23 And he begs him much, saying, “My little daughter is having {her} end; so that, coming, you might lay your hands on her in order that she might be saved, and she might live.”

title: Mark 5:24
content: 24 And he went away with him. And a great crowd was following him and was pressing around him.

title: Mark 5:25
content: 25 And a woman, being with a flow of blood for 12 years,

title: Mark 5:26
content: 26 and having suffered much from many physicians, and having spent everything {that was} from herself, and benefitting nothing, but instead having come to the worse,

title: Mark 5:27
content: 27 having heard the things about Jesus, having come up behind him in the crowd, touched his cloak.

title: Mark 5:28
content: 28 For she was saying, “If I touch just his clothes, I will be saved.”

title: Mark 5:29
content: 29 And immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she knew in her body that she had been healed from the affliction.

title: Mark 5:30
content: 30 And immediately Jesus, having realized in himself the power having gone out from him, having turned around in the crowd, was saying, “Who touched my clothes?”

title: Mark 5:31
content: 31 And his disciples were saying to him, “You see the crowd pressing around you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

title: Mark 5:32
content: 32 And he was looking around to see the one having done this.

title: Mark 5:33
content: 33 And the woman, having become afraid and trembling, having known what had happened to her, came and fell down before him and told him the whole truth.

title: Mark 5:34
content: 34 But he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has saved you. Depart in peace and be healed from your affliction.”

title: Mark 5:35
content: 35 He still speaking, they come from the synagogue ruler, saying, “Your daughter died. Why trouble the teacher further?”

title: Mark 5:36
content: 36 But Jesus, having overheard the word being spoken, says to the synagogue ruler, “Do not fear. Only believe.”

title: Mark 5:37
content: 37 And he did not allow anyone to accompany him except Peter and James and John the brother of James.

title: Mark 5:38
content: 38 And he comes to the house of the leader of the synagogue, and he sees a commotion and weeping and much wailing.

title: Mark 5:39
content: 39 And entering, he says to them, “Why are you being disturbed and weeping? The child did not die but is sleeping.”

title: Mark 5:40
content: 40 And they were laughing at him. But he, having cast {them} all out, takes along the father of the child and the mother and the ones with him, and he enters where the child was.

title: Mark 5:41
content: 41 And having taken the hand of the child, he says to her, “Talitha, koum!” which is translated: “Little girl, I say to you, arise.”

title: Mark 5:42
content: 42 And immediately the little girl rose up and was walking (for she was 12 years), and they were immediately astonished with great amazement.

title: Mark 5:43
content: 43 And he commanded them much that no one might know this, and he said that something should be given to her to eat.

title: Mark 6:1
content: 1 And he went out from there and comes to his hometown, and his disciples are following him.

title: Mark 6:2
content: 2 And a Sabbath having come, he began to teach in the synagogue. And the many ones hearing him were astonished, saying, “From where to this one {are} these things, and what {is} the wisdom that has been given to this one, and such miracles happening by his hands?

title: Mark 6:3
content: 3 Is this not the carpenter, the son of Mary and a brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? And are his sisters not here with us?” And they were being caused to stumble on him.

title: Mark 6:4
content: 4 And Jesus was saying to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his hometown and among his relatives and in his house.”

title: Mark 6:5
content: 5 And he was not able to do any miracle there, except, having laid his hands on a few sick people, he healed {them}.

title: Mark 6:6
content: 6 And he was amazed because of their unbelief. And he was going around the villages in a circle teaching.

title: Mark 6:7
content: 7 And he calls the Twelve and began to send them out two by two, and he was giving them authority over the unclean spirits,

title: Mark 6:8
content: 8 and he commanded them that they should take nothing for the road except only a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in the belt—

title: Mark 6:9
content: 9 but having put on sandals, and, “You may not wear two tunics.”

title: Mark 6:10
content: 10 And he was saying to them, “Whenever you enter into a house, remain there until you go out from there.

title: Mark 6:11
content: 11 And whatever place does not receive you nor listen to you, going out from there, shake off the dust that {is} under your feet for a testimony against them.”

title: Mark 6:12
content: 12 And having gone out, they proclaimed that they should repent.

title: Mark 6:13
content: 13 And they were casting out many demons and anointing many sick {people} with oil and healing them.

title: Mark 6:14
content: 14 And King Herod heard, for his name became known, and they were saying, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and because of this the powers work in him.”

title: Mark 6:15
content: 15 But others were saying, “He is Elijah.” But others were saying, “A prophet, like one of the prophets.”

title: Mark 6:16
content: 16 But Herod, having heard this, was saying, “{The one} whom I beheaded, John, this one has been raised.”

title: Mark 6:17
content: 17 For Herod himself, having sent, seized John and bound him in prison because of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip, because he married her.

title: Mark 6:18
content: 18 For John was saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have the wife of your brother.”

title: Mark 6:19
content: 19 But Herodias was angry with him and was wanting to kill him, and she was not able,

title: Mark 6:20
content: 20 for Herod was fearing John, knowing him {to be} a righteous and holy man, and he was keeping him safe, and having heard him, he was much perplexed, and he was listening to him gladly.

title: Mark 6:21
content: 21 And an opportune day having come, when Herod made a dinner for his birthday for his great ones and for the chiliarchs and for the first of Galilee,

title: Mark 6:22
content: 22 and his daughter, of Herodias, having entered and having danced and having pleased Herod and the ones reclining to eat with {him}, the king said to the girl, “Ask me whatever you desire, and I will give {it} to you.”

title: Mark 6:23
content: 23 And he swore to her, “If you ask me, I will give {it} to you, up to half of my kingdom.”

title: Mark 6:24
content: 24 And having gone out, she said to her mother, “What should I ask?” And she said, “The head of John the Baptist.”

title: Mark 6:25
content: 25 And immediately, having entered in with haste to the king, she requested, saying, “I desire that you would give me at once the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”

title: Mark 6:26
content: 26 And the king, having become deeply grieved because of his oaths and the ones reclining to eat with him, did not want to refuse her,

title: Mark 6:27
content: 27 and the king, immediately having sent an executioner, commanded {him} to bring his head, and having departed, he beheaded him in the prison.

title: Mark 6:28
content: 28 And he brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.

title: Mark 6:29
content: 29 And his disciples, having heard, came and took away his corpse and placed it in a tomb.

title: Mark 6:30
content: 30 And the apostles are gathered together with Jesus and reported to him everything, as much as they did and as much as they taught.

title: Mark 6:31
content: 31 And he says to them, “You yourselves, come by yourselves to a desolate place and rest a little while.” For the ones coming and the ones going were many, and they were not even having opportunity to eat.

title: Mark 6:32
content: 32 And they went away in the boat to a desolate place by themselves.

title: Mark 6:33
content: 33 And they saw them leaving, and many knew, and they ran there together on foot from all the cities, and they arrived before them.

title: Mark 6:34
content: 34 And having come out, he saw a large crowd, and he had compassion on them because they were like sheep not having a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.

title: Mark 6:35
content: 35 And the hour already having become much, his disciples, having come to him, were saying, “This place is desolate, and the hour {is} already much.

title: Mark 6:36
content: 36 Send them away so that, having gone away into the surrounding countryside and villages, they might buy something for themselves {that} they might eat.”

title: Mark 6:37
content: 37 But he, answering, said to them, “You give them to eat.” And they say to him, “Having gone away, might we buy loaves of 200 denarii and give {them} to them to eat?”

title: Mark 6:38
content: 38 But he says to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go. See.” And having known, they say, “Five, and two fish.”

title: Mark 6:39
content: 39 And he commanded them all to recline group by group on the green grass.

title: Mark 6:40
content: 40 And they reclined group by group according to hundreds and according to fifties.

title: Mark 6:41
content: 41 And having taken the five loaves and the two fish, having looked up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves into pieces and was giving them to his disciples so that they might set them before them, and he divided the two fish among all.

title: Mark 6:42
content: 42 And they all ate and were satisfied.

title: Mark 6:43
content: 43 And they took up the broken pieces, the fillings of 12 baskets, and from the fish.

title: Mark 6:44
content: 44 And the ones having eaten the loaves were 5,000 men.

title: Mark 6:45
content: 45 And immediately he compelled his disciples to get into the boat and to go ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he sends the crowd away.

title: Mark 6:46
content: 46 And having said farewell to them, he went to the mountain to pray.

title: Mark 6:47
content: 47 And evening having come, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and he {was} alone on the land.

title: Mark 6:48
content: 48 And having seen them being tormented as they rowed—for the wind was against them—and about the fourth watch of the night, he comes to them, walking on the sea, and he was wishing to pass by them.

title: Mark 6:49
content: 49 But they, having seen him walking on the sea, thought that he is a ghost, and they cried out,

title: Mark 6:50
content: 50 for they all saw him and were troubled. But immediately he spoke with them and says to them, “Take courage! It is I! Do not be afraid!”

title: Mark 6:51
content: 51 And he got into the boat with them, and the wind ceased, and they were very amazed within themselves.

title: Mark 6:52
content: 52 For they did not understand about the loaves, but their heart was having been hardened.

title: Mark 6:53
content: 53 And having crossed over, they came to the land at Gennesaret and anchored there.

title: Mark 6:54
content: 54 And they having come out from the boat, immediately having recognized him,

title: Mark 6:55
content: 55 they ran throughout that whole region, and they began to carry on their mats the ones having sickness where they were hearing that he is.

title: Mark 6:56
content: 56 And wherever he was entering into villages or into cities or into fields, they were placing the ones being sick in the marketplaces, and they were begging him so that they might even touch the edge of his garment, and as many as touched it were being healed.

title: Mark 7:1
content: 1 And the Pharisees and some of the scribes, having come from Jerusalem, are being gathered to him.

title: Mark 7:2
content: 2 And having seen some of his disciples, that they eat loaves with defiled hands, that is, unwashed—

title: Mark 7:3
content: 3 for the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they would wash their hands with a fist, holding to the tradition of the elders;

title: Mark 7:4
content: 4 and from a marketplace, they do not eat unless they baptize, and there are many other things which they received to hold to: baptisms of cups and pitchers and copper vessels—

title: Mark 7:5
content: 5 also the Pharisees and the scribes ask him, “Why do your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but they eat bread with defiled hands?”

title: Mark 7:6
content: 6 But he, answering, said to them, “Isaiah prophesied well about you hypocrites. As it is written, ‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far away from me.

title: Mark 7:7
content: 7 But they worship me in vain, teaching as doctrines commandments of men.’

title: Mark 7:8
content: 8 Having left the commandment of God, you hold to the tradition of men.”

title: Mark 7:9
content: 9 And he was saying to them, “Well do you reject the commandment of God so that you may keep your tradition!

title: Mark 7:10
content: 10 For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘The one speaking evil of his father or mother, let him end in death.’

title: Mark 7:11
content: 11 But you say, ‘If a man says to his father or his mother, “Whatever you might have benefited from me {is} Corban”’ (that is, a gift),

title: Mark 7:12
content: 12 you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or his mother,

title: Mark 7:13
content: 13 setting aside the word of God by your tradition which you handed down, and you do many such similar things.”

title: Mark 7:14
content: 14 And having summoned the crowd again, he was saying to them, “Listen to me, all {of you}, and understand:

title: Mark 7:15
content: 15 there is nothing from outside the man, entering into him, that is able to defile him; but the things that come out from the man are the things defiling the man.

title: Mark 7:16
content: 16 [If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.]”

title: Mark 7:17
content: 17 And when he entered into a house from the crowd, his disciples were asking him about the parable.

title: Mark 7:18
content: 18 And he says to them, “Are you also thus without understanding? Do you not understand that everything that enters into the man from outside is not able to defile him,

title: Mark 7:19
content: 19 because it does not go into his heart, but into the stomach, and passes out into the latrine (cleansing all foods)?”

title: Mark 7:20
content: 20 But he was saying, “What is coming out from the man, that defiles the man.

title: Mark 7:21
content: 21 For from within, from the heart of men, come out evil thoughts, sexual immorality, thefts, murders,

title: Mark 7:22
content: 22 adultery, coveting, wickedness, deceit, sensuality, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, {and} folly.

title: Mark 7:23
content: 23 All these evils come out from within, and they defile the man.”

title: Mark 7:24
content: 24 Now having gotten up from there, he went away to the region of Tyre and Sidon, and having entered into a house, he was wanting no one to know {it}, but he was not able to hide.

title: Mark 7:25
content: 25 But immediately having heard about him, a woman, of whom her little daughter had an unclean spirit, having come, fell down at his feet.

title: Mark 7:26
content: 26 Now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by descent, and she was asking him that he would cast out the demon from her daughter.

title: Mark 7:27
content: 27 And he was saying to her, “Permit the children first to be fed, for it is not good to take the bread of the children and to throw {it} to the little dogs.”

title: Mark 7:28
content: 28 But she answered and says to him, “Yes, Lord, and the little dogs under the table eat from the crumbs of the children.”

title: Mark 7:29
content: 29 And he said to her, “Because of this word, go! The demon has gone out from your daughter.”

title: Mark 7:30
content: 30 And having gone away to her house, she found the child having been put on the bed and the demon having gone out.

title: Mark 7:31
content: 31 And again having gone out from the region of Tyre, he went through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, in the midst of the region of the Decapolis.

title: Mark 7:32
content: 32 And they bring to him {one} deaf and barely able to speak, and they beg him that he would lay his hand on him.

title: Mark 7:33
content: 33 And having taken him aside from the crowd by himself, he put his fingers into his ears, and having spit, he touched his tongue.

title: Mark 7:34
content: 34 And having looked up to heaven, he sighed and says to him, “Ephphatha!” (that is, “Be opened!”).

title: Mark 7:35
content: 35 And his ears were opened, and the bond of his tongue was loosed, and he began speaking rightly.

title: Mark 7:36
content: 36 And he commanded them so that they would tell {it} to no one. But as much as he commanded them, the more abundantly they were proclaiming {it}.

title: Mark 7:37
content: 37 And they were extremely astonished, saying, “He has done all things well, and he makes the deaf to hear and the mute to speak.”

title: Mark 8:1
content: 1 In those days, there again being a great crowd, and not having anything {that} they might eat, having summoned his disciples, he says to them,

title: Mark 8:2
content: 2 “I have compassion on the crowd because they are remaining with me already three days and do not have anything {that} they might eat.

title: Mark 8:3
content: 3 And if I would send them away to their home hungry, they will faint on the way, and some of them have come from far way.”

title: Mark 8:4
content: 4 And his disciples answered him, “From where will anyone be able to satisfy these {people} with loaves here in a desolate place?”

title: Mark 8:5
content: 5 And he asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” And they said, “Seven.”

title: Mark 8:6
content: 6 And he commands the crowd to recline on the ground, and having taken the seven loaves, having given thanks, he broke {them} and was giving {them} to his disciples so that they might set {them} before {them}, and they set {them} before the crowd.

title: Mark 8:7
content: 7 And they had a few small fish, and having blessed them, he said to set these also before {them}.

title: Mark 8:8
content: 8 And they ate and were satisfied, and they took up the remaining of the broken pieces—seven baskets.

title: Mark 8:9
content: 9 Now there were about 4,000, and he sent them away.

title: Mark 8:10
content: 10 And immediately, having gotten into the boat with his disciples, he went into the regions of Dalmanutha.

title: Mark 8:11
content: 11 And the Pharisees came out and began to argue with him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, testing him.

title: Mark 8:12
content: 12 And having sighed greatly in his spirit, he says, “Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly I say to you, if a sign will be given to this generation …”

title: Mark 8:13
content: 13 And having left them, having gotten into {a boat} again, he went away to the other side.

title: Mark 8:14
content: 14 And they forgot to bring loaves, and except for one loaf, they did not have {any} with them in the boat.

title: Mark 8:15
content: 15 And he was commanding them, saying, “See, watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”

title: Mark 8:16
content: 16 And they were reasoning with each other that they have no loaves.

title: Mark 8:17
content: 17 And having known this, Jesus says to them, “Why are you reasoning that you do not have loaves? Do you not yet perceive, nor understand? Has your heart become hardened?

title: Mark 8:18
content: 18 Having eyes, do you not see? And having ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?

title: Mark 8:19
content: 19 When I broke the five loaves for the 5, 000, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?” They say to him, “12.”

title: Mark 8:20
content: 20 “And when the seven for the 4, 000, the fillings of how many baskets of broken pieces did you take up?” And they say to him, “Seven.”

title: Mark 8:21
content: 21 And he was saying to them, “How do you not yet understand?”

title: Mark 8:22
content: 22 And they come to Bethsaida, and they bring to him a blind {man} and beg him that he would touch him.

title: Mark 8:23
content: 23 And having taken hold of the hand of the blind man, he led him out from the village. And having spit into his eyes, having laid his hands on him, he was asking him, “Do you see anything?”

title: Mark 8:24
content: 24 And having looked up, he was saying, “I see men, for I see {them} like trees walking.”

title: Mark 8:25
content: 25 Then he again laid his hands upon his eyes, and he looked intently and was restored, and he was seeing everything clearly.

title: Mark 8:26
content: 26 And he sent him away to his home, saying, “You may not even enter into the town.”

title: Mark 8:27
content: 27 And Jesus and his disciples went out into the villages of Caesarea Philippi, and on the way he was questioning his disciples, saying to them, “Who do men say that I am?”

title: Mark 8:28
content: 28 But they said to him, saying, “John the Baptist, and others, Elijah, but others, one of the prophets.”

title: Mark 8:29
content: 29 And he was questioning them, “But who do you say that I am?” And answering, Peter says to him, “You are the Christ.”

title: Mark 8:30
content: 30 And he strongly warned them that they might tell no one about him.

title: Mark 8:31
content: 31 And he began to teach them that it is necessary for the Son of Man to suffer many things and to be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes and to be killed and to rise up after three days.

title: Mark 8:32
content: 32 And he was speaking the word with openness. And having taken him aside, Peter began to rebuke him.

title: Mark 8:33
content: 33 But Jesus, having turned and having looked at his disciples, rebuked Peter and says, “Get behind me, Satan! For you are not considering the things of God, but the things of men.”

title: Mark 8:34
content: 34 And having summoned the crowd along with his disciples, he said to them, “If anyone wants to follow after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

title: Mark 8:35
content: 35 For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for the sake of me and of the gospel will save it.

title: Mark 8:36
content: 36 For what does it benefit a man to gain the whole world and to forfeit his life?

title: Mark 8:37
content: 37 For what might a man give in exchange for his life?

title: Mark 8:38
content: 38 For whoever is ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”

title: Mark 9:1
content: 1 And he was saying to them, “Truly, I say to you that there are some of the ones standing here who will certainly not taste death until they see the kingdom of God having come with power.”

title: Mark 9:2
content: 2 And after six days, Jesus takes along Peter and James and John and brings them up onto a high mountain by themselves, alone, and he was transfigured before them.

title: Mark 9:3
content: 3 And his garments became radiantly, extremely white, such as no launderer on the earth is able thus to make them white.

title: Mark 9:4
content: 4 And Elijah with Moses were seen by them, and they were talking with Jesus.

title: Mark 9:5
content: 5 And answering, Peter says to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here, and let us make three tents, one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

title: Mark 9:6
content: 6 (For he did not know what he should answer, for they were terrified.)

title: Mark 9:7
content: 7 And a cloud appeared, overshadowing them, and there was a voice from the cloud, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him.”

title: Mark 9:8
content: 8 And suddenly, having looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them, but only Jesus.

title: Mark 9:9
content: 9 And they coming down from the mountain, he ordered them so that they would relate to no one what they had seen, until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

title: Mark 9:10
content: 10 And they kept the word to themselves, discussing together what it is “to rise from the dead.”

title: Mark 9:11
content: 11 And they were questioning him, saying, “Why do the scribes say that it is necessary for Elijah to come first?”

title: Mark 9:12
content: 12 But he was saying to them, “Elijah, having come first, restores all things. And how has it been written about the Son of Man that he would suffer many things and be despised?

title: Mark 9:13
content: 13 But I say to you that also Elijah has come, and they did to him whatever they were wanting, just as it is written about him.”

title: Mark 9:14
content: 14 And having come to the disciples, they saw a great crowd around them and scribes arguing with them.

title: Mark 9:15
content: 15 And immediately, the whole crowd, having seen him, were amazed, and running up to {him}, they were greeting him.

title: Mark 9:16
content: 16 And he asked them, “What are you arguing with them about?”

title: Mark 9:17
content: 17 And one from the crowd answered him, “Teacher, I brought my son to you, having a mute spirit.

title: Mark 9:18
content: 18 And wherever it might seize him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth and grinds his teeth, and he becomes stiff, and I spoke to your disciples so that they would cast it out, and they were not able.”

title: Mark 9:19
content: 19 But answering them, he says, “O unbelieving generation, until when will I be with you? Until when will I bear with you? Bring him to me.”

title: Mark 9:20
content: 20 And they brought him to him, and having seen him, the spirit immediately shook him with convulsions, and having fallen on the ground, he was rolling around, foaming at the mouth.

title: Mark 9:21
content: 21 And he asked his father, “How much time is it while this has been happening to him?” And he said, “From childhood.

title: Mark 9:22
content: 22 And it has often thrown him both into fire and into waters in order that it might destroy him, but if you are able to do anything, help us, having compassion on us.”

title: Mark 9:23
content: 23 But Jesus said to him, “‘If you are able’? All things are possible for the one believing.”

title: Mark 9:24
content: 24 And immediately the father of the child, having cried out, was saying, “I believe! Help my unbelief!”

title: Mark 9:25
content: 25 And Jesus, having seen that a crowd is running to {them}, rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “Mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out from him, and never enter into him again.”

title: Mark 9:26
content: 26 And having cried out and having convulsed him much, it came out, and he became like a dead {person}, so that many said, “He has died.”

title: Mark 9:27
content: 27 But Jesus, having taken his hand, raised him up, and he got up.

title: Mark 9:28
content: 28 And he having gone into a house, his disciples were asking him privately, “Why were we not able to cast it out?”

title: Mark 9:29
content: 29 And he said to them, “This kind is able to come out by nothing except by prayer and fasting.”

title: Mark 9:30
content: 30 And having gone out from there, they were passing through Galilee, and he was not wanting that anyone would know,

title: Mark 9:31
content: 31 for he was teaching his disciples and saying to them, “The Son of Man is being handed over into the hands of men, and they will kill him. And having been killed, he will rise up after three days.”

title: Mark 9:32
content: 32 But they were not understanding the word, and they were afraid to ask him.

title: Mark 9:33
content: 33 And they came to Capernaum, and being in the house, he was asking them, “What were you discussing on the way?”

title: Mark 9:34
content: 34 But they were silent, for they had been arguing with one another on the way about who {was} greatest.

title: Mark 9:35
content: 35 And having sat down, he called the Twelve together and says to them, “If anyone wants to be first, he will be last of all and a servant of all.”

title: Mark 9:36
content: 36 And having taken a little child, he set him in the midst of them, and having taken him in his arms, he said to them,

title: Mark 9:37
content: 37 “Whoever receives one of these little children in my name receives me; and whoever receives me does not receive me but the one having sent me.”

title: Mark 9:38
content: 38 John was saying to him, “Teacher, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we were preventing him because he was not following with us.”

title: Mark 9:39
content: 39 But Jesus said, “Do not prevent him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name and will be able soon afterwards to speak evil about me.

title: Mark 9:40
content: 40 For whoever is not against us is for us.

title: Mark 9:41
content: 41 For whoever gives you a cup of water in the name that you are Christ’s, truly I say to you that he will certainly not lose his reward.

title: Mark 9:42
content: 42 And whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it is better for him instead if a millstone of a donkey is put around his neck and he has been thrown into the sea.

title: Mark 9:43
content: 43 And if your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life crippled than, having two hands, to go away into Gehenna, into the unquenchable fire

title: Mark 9:44
content: 44 [where their worm does not end, and the fire is not quenched].

title: Mark 9:45
content: 45 And if your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame than, having two feet, to be thrown into Gehenna

title: Mark 9:46
content: 46 [where their worm does not end, and the fire is not quenched].

title: Mark 9:47
content: 47 And if your eye causes you to stumble, throw it out. It is better for you to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye than, having two eyes, to be thrown into Gehenna,

title: Mark 9:48
content: 48 where their worm does not end, and the fire is not quenched.

title: Mark 9:49
content: 49 For everyone will be salted with fire.

title: Mark 9:50
content: 50 Salt is good, but if the salt becomes unsalty, with what will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”

title: Mark 10:1
content: 1 And having gotten up, he goes from that place to the regions of Judea and beyond the Jordan, and the crowds come together to him again. And he was teaching them again, as he had been accustomed {to do}.

title: Mark 10:2
content: 2 And having approached, the Pharisees were questioning him whether it is lawful for a husband to divorce a wife, testing him.

title: Mark 10:3
content: 3 But he, answering, said to them, “What did Moses command you?”

title: Mark 10:4
content: 4 And they said, “Moses permitted him to write a certificate of divorce and to divorce her.”

title: Mark 10:5
content: 5 But Jesus said to them, “Because of your hardness of heart, he wrote this commandment to you.

title: Mark 10:6
content: 6 But from the beginning of creation, ‘He made them male and female.’

title: Mark 10:7
content: 7 ‘Because of this, a man will leave his father and mother,

title: Mark 10:8
content: 8 and the two will be one flesh.’ So then, they are no longer two, but one flesh.

title: Mark 10:9
content: 9 Therefore, what God joined together, let man not separate.”

title: Mark 10:10
content: 10 And in the house again, the disciples were asking him about this.

title: Mark 10:11
content: 11 And he says to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.

title: Mark 10:12
content: 12 And if she, having divorced her husband, marries another, she commits adultery.”

title: Mark 10:13
content: 13 And they were bringing little children to him so that he might touch them, but the disciples rebuked them.

title: Mark 10:14
content: 14 But having seen this, Jesus was indignant and said to them, “Permit the little children to come to me, and do not forbid them, for of the ones such as these is the kingdom of God.

title: Mark 10:15
content: 15 Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will certainly not enter into it.”

title: Mark 10:16
content: 16 And having taken them into his arms, he blessed {them}, placing his hands on them.

title: Mark 10:17
content: 17 And he going out on the way, one, having run up to {him} and having knelt before him, was asking him, “Good Teacher, what should I do in order that I might inherit eternal life?”

title: Mark 10:18
content: 18 But Jesus said to him, “Why are you calling me good? No one {is} good except one—God.

title: Mark 10:19
content: 19 You know the commandments—do not kill, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not testify falsely, do not defraud, honor your father and mother.”

content: 20 But he said to him, “Teacher, all these things I have kept from my youth.”

title: Mark 10:21
content: 21 But Jesus, having looked at him, loved him, and said to him, “One thing you lack; go, sell as much as you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.”

content: 22 But he, having become downcast at this word, went away being grieved, for he was having many possessions.

content: 23 And having looked around, Jesus says to his disciples, “How difficultly do the ones having riches enter into the kingdom of God!”

content: 24 And the disciples were astonished at his words, but again answering, Jesus says to them, “Children, how hard it is to enter into the kingdom of God!

title: Mark 10:25
content: 25 It is easier for a camel to pass through an eye of a needle than for a rich {person} to enter into the kingdom of God.”

title: Mark 10:26
content: 26 And they were greatly astonished, saying to him, “And who is able to be saved?”

title: Mark 10:27
content: 27 Having looked at them, Jesus says, “With men {it is} impossible, but not with God. For all things {are} possible with God.”

title: Mark 10:28
content: 28 Peter began to speak to him, “Behold, we left everything and have followed you.”

title: Mark 10:29
content: 29 Jesus was saying, “Truly I say to you, there is no one who has left a house or brothers or sisters or a mother or a father or children or lands, for the sake of me and of the gospel,

title: Mark 10:30
content: 30 who will not receive 100 times {as much} now in this time: houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands with persecutions, and in the age that is coming, eternal life.

title: Mark 10:31
content: 31 But many first will be last, and last, first.”

title: Mark 10:32
content: 32 Now they were on the way, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going ahead of them. And they were amazed, but the ones following behind were afraid. And having taken the Twelve aside again, he began to tell them the things being about to happen to him:

title: Mark 10:33
content: 33 “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes, and they will condemn him to death and hand him over to the Gentiles.

title: Mark 10:34
content: 34 And they will mock him and spit on him and whip him and kill {him}, and after three days, he will rise.”

title: Mark 10:35
content: 35 And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, approach him, saying to him, “Teacher, we desire that whatever we ask you, you do for us.”

title: Mark 10:36
content: 36 And he said to them, “What do you desire {that} I do for you?”

content: 37 And they said to him, “Grant to us that we might sit in your glory, one at your right hand and one at your left hand.”

title: Mark 10:38
content: 38 But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup which I drink or to be baptized with the baptism with which I am being baptized?”

title: Mark 10:39

content: 40 But to sit at my right hand or at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.”

title: Mark 10:41
content: 41 And having heard this, the ten began to be very angry with James and John.

title: Mark 10:42
content: 42 And having summoned them, Jesus says to them, “You know that the ones considered rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

content: 43 But it is not this way among you. Instead, whoever desires to become great among you will be your servant,

title: Mark 10:44

title: Mark 10:45
content: 45 For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve and to give his life as a ransom in exchange for many.”

title: Mark 10:46
content: 46 And they come into Jericho, and he and his disciples and a great crowd going out from Jericho, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, son of Timaeus, was sitting beside the road.

title: Mark 10:47
content: 47 And having heard that it is Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out and to say, “Son of David, Jesus, have mercy on me!”

title: Mark 10:48
content: 48 And many were rebuking him, so that he would be silent, but he was crying out much more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

title: Mark 10:49
content: 49 And having stood still, Jesus said, “Call him.” And they call the blind {man}, saying to him, “Take courage! Get up! He is calling you.”

title: Mark 10:50
content: 50 And having thrown aside his coat, having sprung up, he came to Jesus.

title: Mark 10:51
content: 51 And answering him, Jesus said, “What do you desire {that} I might do for you?” And the blind man said to him, “Rabbi, that I might see again.”

title: Mark 10:52
content: 52 And Jesus said to him, “Go. Your faith has saved you.” And immediately he saw again, and he was following him on the road.

title: Mark 11:1
content: 1 And when they come near to Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany, to the Mount of Olives, he sends out two of his disciples

content: 2 and says to them, “Go into the village opposite you, and immediately, entering into it, you will find a colt tied up, on which no one of men has yet sat. Untie it and bring it {here}.

content: 3 And if anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord has need of it and immediately he sends it back here.’”

content: 4 And they went away and found a colt having been tied up at a door outside on the street, and they untie it.

content: 5 And some of the ones standing there were saying to them, “What are you doing, untying the colt?”

content: 7 And they brought the colt to Jesus and throw their cloaks upon it, and he sat on it.

content: 8 And many spread their cloaks on the road, and others, branches, having cut {them} from the fields.

content: 9 Both the ones going before and the ones following were crying out, “Hosanna! Blessed is the one coming in the name of the Lord.

content: 10 Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David! Hosanna in the highest!”

title: Mark 11:11
content: 11 And he entered into Jerusalem, into the temple; and having looked around at everything, the hour already being late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve.

title: Mark 11:12
content: 12 And the next day, they having come out from Bethany, he was hungry.

title: Mark 11:14
content: 14 And answering, he said to it, “May no one any longer eat fruit from you to eternity.” And his disciples heard {it}.

title: Mark 11:15
content: 15 And they come into Jerusalem. And having entered into the temple, he began to cast out the ones selling and the ones buying in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of the ones selling the doves,

content: 18 And the chief priests and the scribes heard this, and they were seeking how they might destroy him, for they were fearing him, for all the crowd was being amazed at his teaching.

title: Mark 11:19
content: 19 And when evening came, they were going out outside the city.

title: Mark 11:20
content: 20 And passing by in the morning, they saw the fig tree having withered from the roots.

title: Mark 11:21
content: 21 And having been reminded, Peter says to him, “Rabbi, behold! The fig tree that you cursed has withered.”

title: Mark 11:22

content: 24 Because of this, I say to you, everything, as much as you pray and request, believe that you have received {it}, and it will be to you.

title: Mark 11:26
content: 26 [But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in the heavens forgive your trespasses.]”

title: Mark 11:27
content: 27 And they come to Jerusalem again, and he walking in the temple, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders come to him.

content: 31 And they were reasoning with each other, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘For what {reason} then did you not believe him?’

title: Mark 11:33

title: Mark 12:1
content: 1 And he began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard and put a hedge around it and dug a pit for a winepress and built a watchtower and rented it out to farmers and went abroad.

content: 2 And at the time he sent a servant to the farmers so that he might receive from the farmers from the fruits of the vineyard.

content: 3 And having seized him, they beat {him}, and sent {him} away empty.

Is it lawful to give a poll tax to Caesar, or not? Should we give, or should we not give?”

content: 15 But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why do you test me? Bring to me a denarius so that I might look at {it}.”

content: 32 And the scribe said to him, “Well, Teacher! On the basis of truth you have said that he is one, and there is no other besides him.

title: Mark 12:38

content: 25 and the stars will be falling from heaven, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.

title: Mark 13:37

content: 6 But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you causing trouble for her? She did a good work in me.

content: 10 And Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went away to the chief priests so that he might hand him over to them.

content: 13 And he sends two of his disciples and says to them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him.

content: 22 And they eating, having taken bread, having blessed, he broke {it} and gave {it} to them and said, “Take. This is my body.”
