content: 38 Be alert and pray so that you do not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed {is} willing, but the flesh {is} weak.”

title: Mark 14:39
content: 39 And again, having gone away, he prayed, having said the same word.

title: Mark 14:40
content: 40 And having come again, he found them sleeping, for their eyes were weighed down, and they did not know what they might answer him.

title: Mark 14:41
content: 41 And he comes the third time and says to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? It is enough! The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is handed over into the hands of the sinners.

title: Mark 14:42
content: 42 Get up, let us go. Behold, the one handing me over has come near.”

title: Mark 14:43
content: 43 And immediately, he still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrives, and a crowd with him with swords and clubs from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.

title: Mark 14:44
content: 44 Now the one handing him over had given them a signal, saying, “Whomever I kiss is he. Seize him and lead {him} away securely.”

title: Mark 14:45
content: 45 And having come, immediately having approached him, he says, “Rabbi,” and he kissed him.

title: Mark 14:46
content: 46 And they laid their hands on {him} and seized him.

title: Mark 14:47
content: 47 But a certain one of the ones standing by, having drawn his sword, struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.

title: Mark 14:48
content: 48 And answering, Jesus said to them, “As against a robber have you come out with swords and clubs to seize me?

title: Mark 14:49
content: 49 Every day I was with you in the temple teaching, and you did not seize me. But so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled.”

title: Mark 14:50
content: 50 And having left him, they all fled.

title: Mark 14:51
content: 51 And a certain young man was following him, wearing a linen garment over his naked body. And they seize him,

title: Mark 14:52
content: 52 but he, having left behind the linen garment, fled naked.

title: Mark 14:53
content: 53 And they led Jesus away to the high priest, and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes gather together.

title: Mark 14:54
content: 54 And Peter followed him from a distance, as far as inside into the courtyard of the high priest, and he was sitting with the officers and warming himself at the fire.

title: Mark 14:55
content: 55 Now the chief priests and the entire Sanhedrin were seeking testimony against Jesus to put him to death, and they were not finding {any}.

title: Mark 14:56
content: 56 For many were testifying falsely against him, and their testimonies were not the same.

title: Mark 14:57
content: 57 And certain ones, having stood up, were testifying falsely against him, saying,

title: Mark 14:58
content: 58 “We heard him saying, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’”

title: Mark 14:59
content: 59 And not even in this manner was their testimony the same.

title: Mark 14:60
content: 60 And having stood up in the midst, the high priest questioned Jesus, saying, “Do you not answer anything? What are these testifying against you?”

title: Mark 14:61
content: 61 But he was silent and did not answer anything. Again the high priest was questioning him and says to him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”

title: Mark 14:62
content: 62 And Jesus said, “I am; and you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”

title: Mark 14:63
content: 63 But the high priest, having torn his tunics, says, “Why do we still have need of witnesses?

title: Mark 14:64
content: 64 You have heard the blasphemy. What is evident to you?” And they all condemned him to be deserving of death.

title: Mark 14:65
content: 65 And certain ones began to spit on him and to blindfold his face and to beat him and to say to him, “Prophesy!” And the officers received him with slaps.

title: Mark 14:66
content: 66 And Peter being below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest comes.

title: Mark 14:67
content: 67 And having seen Peter warming himself, having looked closely at him, she says, “You also were with the Nazarene, Jesus.”

title: Mark 14:68
content: 68 But he denied {it}, saying, “Neither have I known, nor do I understand what you are saying.” And he went out, outside into the forecourt.

title: Mark 14:69
content: 69 And the servant girl, having seen him {there}, began to say again to the ones standing around, “This one is from them!”

title: Mark 14:70
content: 70 But he was denying {it} again. And after a little {while} the ones standing around again were saying to Peter, “Truly you are from them, for also you are a Galilean.”

title: Mark 14:71
content: 71 And he began to curse and to swear, “I do not know this man whom you are talking about.”

title: Mark 14:72
content: 72 And immediately a rooster crowed a second time, and Peter remembered the word that Jesus said to him: “Before a rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times,” and having broken down, he was weeping.

title: Mark 15:1
content: 1 And immediately in the morning, having made counsel, the chief priests with the elders and scribes and the entire Sanhedrin, having bound Jesus, led {him} away and handed {him} over to Pilate.

title: Mark 15:2
content: 2 And Pilate questioned him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” But he, answering him, says, “You say {it}.”

title: Mark 15:3
content: 3 And the chief priests were accusing him of many things.

title: Mark 15:4
content: 4 Now Pilate again was questioning him, saying, “Do you not answer anything? See how many things they are accusing you!”

title: Mark 15:5
content: 5 But Jesus no longer answered anything, so as to amaze Pilate.

title: Mark 15:6
content: 6 Now at the festival, he was releasing to them one prisoner whom they were requesting.

title: Mark 15:7
content: 7 Now there was the one called Barabbas, having been bound with the rebels, who had committed murder in the insurrection.

title: Mark 15:8
content: 8 And having come up, the crowd began to request just as he was doing for them.

title: Mark 15:9
content: 9 And Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want {that} I would release to you the King of the Jews?”

title: Mark 15:10
content: 10 For he knew that the chief priests had handed him over because of envy.

title: Mark 15:11
content: 11 But the chief priests stirred up the crowd so that he would release Barabbas to them instead.

title: Mark 15:12
content: 12 And Pilate, answering again, was saying to them, “What therefore should I do {with the one} you call the King of the Jews?”

title: Mark 15:13
content: 13 But they cried out again, “Crucify him!”

title: Mark 15:14
content: 14 But Pilate was saying to them, “For what evil did he do?” But they cried out even more, “Crucify him.”

title: Mark 15:15
content: 15 Now Pilate, wanting to do {what} was pleasing to the crowd, released Barabbas to them and handed Jesus over, having flogged {him}, so that he might be crucified.

title: Mark 15:16
content: 16 Now the soldiers led him inside the courtyard (that is, the Praetorium) and call together the whole cohort

title: Mark 15:17
content: 17 and put on him a purple robe and place on him, having woven {it} together, a crown of thorns,

title: Mark 15:18
content: 18 and they began to greet him: “Rejoice, King of the Jews!”

title: Mark 15:19
content: 19 And they were striking his head with a reed and spitting on him, and bending the knee, they were bowing down to him.

title: Mark 15:20
content: 20 And when they had mocked him, they took the purple robe off him and put his robes on him and lead him out so that they might crucify him.

title: Mark 15:21
content: 21 And they press into service a certain passerby, Simon, a Cyrenean (the father of Alexander and Rufus), coming from the country, so that he might carry his cross.

title: Mark 15:22
content: 22 And they bring him to the place Golgotha, which is translated, “Place of a Skull.”

title: Mark 15:23
content: 23 And they were giving to him wine having been mixed with myrrh, but he did not receive {it}.

title: Mark 15:24
content: 24 And having crucified him, also they divide his garments, casting a lot for them, who would take what.

title: Mark 15:25
content: 25 Now it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

title: Mark 15:26
content: 26 And this was the inscription of his charge, having been written: “The King of the Jews.”

title: Mark 15:27
content: 27 And they crucify two robbers with him, one at his right and one at his left.

title: Mark 15:28
content: 28 [And the scripture was fulfilled that says, “And he was counted with lawless ones.”]

title: Mark 15:29
content: 29 And the ones passing by were blaspheming him, wagging their heads and saying, “Aha! The one destroying the temple and rebuilding {it} in three days,

title: Mark 15:30
content: 30 save yourself, having come down from the cross!”

title: Mark 15:31
content: 31 Likewise also the chief priests, mocking {him} to each other with the scribes, were saying, “He saved others; he is not able to save himself.

title: Mark 15:32
content: 32 Let the Christ, the King of Israel, come down now from the cross so that we might see and might believe,” and the ones having been crucified with him were reviling him.

title: Mark 15:33
content: 33 And the sixth hour having come, darkness happened over the whole land until the ninth hour.

title: Mark 15:34
content: 34 And at the ninth hour, Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which is translated, “My God, my God, why did you forsake me?”

title: Mark 15:35
content: 35 And some of the ones having stood by, having heard {it}, were saying, “Behold, he calls Elijah.”

title: Mark 15:36
content: 36 And someone, having run and having filled a sponge with vinegar, having put {it} around a reed, was giving {it} to him to drink, saying, “Leave {him}! Let us see if Elijah comes to take him down!”

title: Mark 15:37
content: 37 And Jesus, having let out a loud voice, expired.

title: Mark 15:38
content: 38 And the curtain of the temple was split in two from top to bottom.

title: Mark 15:39
content: 39 Now the centurion, having stood by opposite him, having seen that he expired in this way, said, “Truly this man was a Son of God.”

title: Mark 15:40
content: 40 Now there were also women watching from a distance, among whom {were} also Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James the little and of Joses and Salome,

title: Mark 15:41
content: 41 who, when he was in Galilee, were following him and serving him, and many other {women} who had come up with him to Jerusalem.

title: Mark 15:42
content: 42 And evening already having come, because it was the Day of Preparation, that is, the day before the Sabbath,

title: Mark 15:43
content: 43 Joseph, the one from Arimathea, a respected member of the council who also himself was waiting for the kingdom of God, having come, having dared, entered in to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.

title: Mark 15:44
content: 44 But Pilate marveled if he had already died, and having called the centurion, he questioned him, whether he had already died.

title: Mark 15:45
content: 45 And having learned from the centurion, he gave the corpse to Joseph.

title: Mark 15:46
content: 46 And having bought a linen cloth, having taken him down, he wrapped {him} in the linen cloth and put him in a tomb, which was having been cut from rock. And he rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.

title: Mark 15:47
content: 47 Now Mary Magdalene and Mary the {mother} of Joses were watching where he had been put.

title: Mark 16:1
content: 1 And the Sabbath having passed, Mary Magdalene and Mary the {mother} of James and Salome bought spices so that, having come, they might anoint him.

title: Mark 16:2
content: 2 And very early on the first of the week, they arrive at the tomb, the sun having come up.

title: Mark 16:3
content: 3 And they were saying to one another, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the door of the tomb?”

title: Mark 16:4
content: 4 And having looked up, they see that the stone has been rolled away, for it was extremely large.

title: Mark 16:5
content: 5 And having entered into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were alarmed.

title: Mark 16:6
content: 6 But he says to them, “Do not be alarmed. You seek Jesus, the Nazarene, the one having been crucified. He was raised up! He is not here. Behold, {this is} the place where they put him.

title: Mark 16:7
content: 7 But go, say to his disciples and to Peter, ‘He is going before you to Galilee. There you will see him, just as he said to you.’”

title: Mark 16:8
content: 8 And having gone out, they fled from the tomb, for trembling and amazement was gripping them. And they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.

title: Mark 16:9
content: 9 [Now having arisen early in the morning on the first of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

title: Mark 16:10
content: 10 That {one}, going, reported {it} to the ones having been with him, mourning and weeping.

title: Mark 16:11
content: 11 And those {ones}, having heard that he lives and was seen by her, did not believe.

title: Mark 16:12
content: 12 Now after these things, he appeared in a different form to two of them walking, going into the country.

title: Mark 16:13
content: 13 And those {ones}, having gone away, reported {it} to the rest, but they did not believe those {ones}.

title: Mark 16:14
content: 14 Now later, he appeared to the Eleven, they reclining to eat, and he rebuked their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe the ones having seen him, having been raised from the dead.

title: Mark 16:15
content: 15 And he said to them, “Having gone into all the world, preach the gospel to all the creation.

title: Mark 16:16
content: 16 The one having believed and having been baptized will be saved, but the one not having believed will be condemned.

title: Mark 16:17
content: 17 Now these signs will accompany the ones having believed: In my name they will cast out demons; they will speak in new tongues;

title: Mark 16:18
content: 18 they will pick up snakes, and if they drink anything deadly, it will certainly not hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will get well.”

title: Mark 16:19
content: 19 After he spoke to them, the Lord Jesus was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.

title: Mark 16:20
content: 20 Now those {ones}, having gone out, preached everywhere, the Lord working with {them} and confirming the word through the accompanying signs. Amen.]
